title: Amazon KDP Niche Research Tutorial for Beginners 2026

tactics.name: Book Bolt Filters
tactics.description: Use Book Bolt's product research module with BSR, review count, and sales filters to identify low-competition niches.
steps: Set BSR range (100,000-200,000), estimated sales (30-5,000/month), price ($7-$20), and review count (max 50).
Apply filters to categories like coloring books, planners, or notebooks.
Sort results by BSR low-to-high to find underserved niches.
caveats: Filters may exclude emerging niches with higher review counts
source_quotes: I set maximum review count to 50. So I am only looking for books that are selling and they have less number of reviews

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If average BSR is below 20,000 and review count < 20, prioritize niche
source_quotes: Estimated sales are 423. Average BSR is 19,000

claims.statement: Book Bolt's product research module allows filtering by BSR, sales estimates, and review counts for niche discovery.
source_quotes: They have recently improved their product research module

niche_patterns.example: Christmas coloring books + holiday season + limited-time demand
niche_patterns.description: Target seasonal niches with low competition and high search volume during specific periods.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines timely relevance with lower saturation for new authors.
source_quotes: These are all holiday season coloring books ranking well on Amazon
